attributes.action: no matter what time in the pregnancy women should be allowed a death certificate
attributes.background: I was 11 weeks pregnant and had a miscarriage it was a horrible experience and not being allowed a death certificate made it a lot harder to cope it makes us feel as though your baby didn't exist when they did a death certificate after a miscarriage any time in the pregnancy should be allowed.
attributes.additional_details: A death certificate is a coping method as well used making it feel like you're baby did exist but not long enough for a birth certificate all couples should be allowed one as a way of coping and feeling like their baby was there.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from party politics
attributes.background: Remove the NHS from party politics. Consider an option similar to an independent non-political NHS committee that will be responsible for the budget and running of the NHS. Often the NHS is a political football and used to gain seats in elections. It needs to be run independently outside of politics
attributes.additional_details: When it comes to the day-to-day running of the NHS, the role of national politics should be significantly reduced.

attributes.action: Force large landowners to increase afforestation to stop flooding downstream
attributes.background: The risk of flooding in lowland areas is currently been increased by large landowners increasing the level of drainage and not increasing the percentage of land covered by woodland. Increases in woodland would both reduce the speed and  water levels reaching watercourses and preventing flooding.
attributes.additional_details: Flooding in low lying areas is caused by four main factors: precipitation levels, level of development on floodplains, speed of water reaching local watercourses and amount reaching watercourses. This petition is trying to encourage legislation in two of these four factors: speed and amount of water reaching local watercourses. Watersheds need vast increases in woodland to slow down water speeds through the leaves of trees, soil saturation and vegetation using water resources.

attributes.action: Introduce a higher living wage for zero hours contracts.
attributes.background: Zero hours contracts provide flexibility for employers, and uncertainty and stress for employees.  The living wage for zero hours contracts should be increased by an amount that encourages employers to provide stable employment whilst allowing employers to satisfy their genuinly volatile workloads

attributes.action: Add 1p tax on all cartons/bottles/packet sold - money used to clean our streets
attributes.background: Our cities are getting filthier because of the litter, even our countryside is now suffering badly. Councils find it ever harder to deal with this issue with budgetary restraints, particularly in rural areas. Adding 1p to an item will not add much to its cost but could have a very positive effect.
attributes.additional_details: I recently walked two miles of a country lane and collected 28 black bags of plastic and cans! We are sinking in rubbish. A 1p levy on each item (multi packs - 12 pack would pay 12p more) would raise a huge amount of money and could be granted to local councils 'ring fenced' to pay for new employees to clean up the problem.

attributes.action: A child born of British parent(s) shall not require a visa to enter/live in UK.
attributes.background: In line with the Human Rights of Children.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to stop children going to the toilet at school
attributes.background:
At school children are constantly told they cannot go to the toilet.
Going to the toilet is a basic human right and should not be taken away from you at school.

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Have reciprocal laws for countries that do not allow property purchases
attributes.background:
Countries such as Thailand, Mexico, Hong Kong, Malaysia, all have rules that limit what a foreigner can buy or own in the terms of property and land. Yet in the UK, people from these countries can buy land or property with zero problems.
Its time that the UK government passed reciprocal laws.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.macleans.ca/economy/economicanalysis/how-the-rest-of-the-world-limits-foreign-home-buyers/

http://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/foreign-property-buyers-in-australia-face-sweeping-crackdown/news-story/21794ae0b79f2b46040bc3e5a4a7b0db

http://www.china.org.cn/english/LivinginChina/220516.htm

https://www.justlanded.com/english/Thailand/Thailand-Guide/Property/Legal-restrictions

attributes.action: Regulate over-bright cycle lights.
attributes.background: Bike lights are now as bright as car headlamps and are a danger to other road users. The British Standard for them needs to be updated to make sure that they don't dazzle car drivers, pedestrians, and other cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
As UK Cycling say:
"When it comes to bike lamps, the British Standard is out of date to the point of irrelevance. Your chance of finding a genuinely BS6102/3 headlamp in a specialist bike shop is close to zero and most of those on the market are simply designed to deliver as much bang as possible for the cyclist’s buck. And that’s no bad thing - until you meet one coming the other way!"

attributes.action: Ban vans from the third lane of motorways
attributes.background: I find that as vans have become much more sporty they often use the second overtaking lane of motorways. If you are driving a car or motorcycle in this lane and a van pulls out in front of you, you can't see through or round it.
attributes.additional_details: This is from personal experience and talking to friends and colleagues

attributes.action: We should adapt to the same laws Canada has on young relationships
attributes.background: Many teenagers today are tried and parents try to prosecute other kids for simply dating there child even if there 1/2-years younger. We should adapt to the same laws Canada has in this field by making it so you can date anyone within a 3-year age gap if one is over 16 and one is under 16.
attributes.additional_details:
Also don't get me wrong I'm not saying have sex that should remain illegal till there 16, but kissing/cuddling etc is considered sexual contact and I think the law should be changed to prevent innocent people being prosecuted for that.

No 16-year old should be given a trial for dating someone 1-year younger when we have a older generation some with 20-year age gaps and then be quick to judge a small age gap

We need to protect children and focus on what the law was made for. Predatory Old men.

attributes.action: Urge people to NOT book to go on holiday in the USA until Trump leaves office.
attributes.background: Since Trump wants to exclude certain people based solely on their religion and where they're from, and not because they committed an offence, I think we should show support by choosing not to visit the USA simply to go on holiday. I'd say especially stay away from Trump Hotels.

attributes.action: Ban all political parties from putting election boards on lamp posts through NI
attributes.background: Are you sick of seeing election boards on lamp posts/telegraph poles throughout Northern Ireland every time there is an election of some kind? Would you like to see the money they waste better spent ? If so, please sign this petition and get it banned .

attributes.action: Make teachers shouting at students a criminal offence
attributes.background: After finding it rather upsetting and difficult after having being shouted at by a teacher and seeing no purpose in this form of abuse , I feel that rules need to be put in place to Stop the Shouting.

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.

attributes.action: More Financial transparency for care leavers going into higher education.
attributes.background: Care leavers that come from disadvantaged backgrounds should be given total transparency over what actual support is available to them when accessing higher education. More fincial support should be offered as student loans at 7k per year is not enough specially when not at uni in the summer time.

attributes.action: Mersey Tunnel Bill to be repealed so that its provisions no longer apply.
attributes.background: The provision of the Bill has a negative effect on the economy of the North West of England.

attributes.action: Abolish the 5% VAT on children's car seats
attributes.background: Currently, the VAT on children’s car seats is at the reduced rate of 5%. However, by law children must use a car seat until they’re 12 years old or 135 centimetres tall (whichever comes first).
attributes.additional_details: It seems ridiculous to apply VAT to something when doing so could potentially result in parents compromising on their child's safety. If children's clothing is zero-rated then car seats for children and babies should be too.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sat navs designed for cars by lorries
attributes.background: Lorries using sat navs designed for cars have caused numerous accidents by driving down roads not intended for use by lorries

attributes.action: Make DVSA to allow cameras during the driving exams.
attributes.background:
There are too many wrongful decisions and incompetent driving examiners out there, but DVSA does not allow any recording, inside or outside of the vehicle during examinations.
Lets allow filming of exams, to put pressure on examiners to judge exams fairly, and to keep record for despute if needed.

attributes.action: The Government should set up an independent body to monitor MPs Social Media
attributes.background: Social media usage by MPs is on the increase and given their influence over potential voters it is important that the posts that MPs write, share and endorse are clear and honest and not misleading or false in anyway. The Government  should set up an independent body to monitor these accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Some voters accept as genuine, without question, posts on social media that are either written, endorsed or shared by MPs. The government should set up an independent body to monitor and police MPs Social Media accounts. Were it can be proven an MP has intentionally lied or spread false information on Social Media, this body should have regulatory powers to impose sanctions and or fines on the MPs responsible. It is important that MPs are seen to be as transparent as possible.

attributes.action: The National Insurance Tax to fund the NHS; Social Care & Pensions.
attributes.background:
This would ensure everyone will have contributed to their state benefits. There are more people than homes.
Funding from the councils is selective and is a second time tax by the government imposed on the few.

attributes.action: £1pw contribution to help fund NHS by ALL adults irrespective of age and income
attributes.background: I propose an idea to help fund our beloved NHS and Care Services  before they collapse under the pressure. A compulsory contribution of £1pw from all adults, controversially regardless of age and income. This would raise around 2.6b a year.
attributes.additional_details: I have calculated £2.6b a year by using the simple calculation of approx 50m adults (over 16) in UK x £1 = £50m x 52 wks = £2.600.000.000. 16 would be the starting age if not in education. For this to work I believe everyone needs to contribute. It would be easy to start excluding people because of age and income etc but this would put a greater financial burden on fewer people who would resist the charges. The NHS is freely available to all, so a small weekly contribution of £1 seems fair.

attributes.action: Pair schools here with school in developing world to send over technology.
attributes.background: In order to help implement resources to help out children in the developing world we think that by donating technology we can make a difference to their lives. For example, a computer could help give children an insight in different opportunities available

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Carers leave for those in full time employment to care for an immediate relative
attributes.background: Having seen the NHS crisis it is clear that most of the problem is "bed blocking" patients who's treatment is complete but cannot go home as there is no home care in place. Instead of waiting for Social care to be sorted. It would be preferable for a relative to be allowed paid leave.
attributes.additional_details: This could become a right in the same way as maternity leave. Used for short term care to relieve strains on social care as has recently been disclosed on News media.

attributes.action: Make every individual who claims job seekers take a drug test before claiming.
attributes.background: This is to stop individuals who claim job seekers claiming whilst containing illegal drugs in their systems. Every job seekers claimant should be free from illegal drugs and it should be a legal requirement to prove this before given their money.

attributes.action: Give the police a return deadline when an item has been seized.
attributes.background: Give the police a 2 month deadline from the date of arrest, once they have seized any item for any form of forensic analysis. After 2 months, they MUST give the property back to the suspect (unless the item has evidence on convicting them of a crime).
attributes.additional_details: A while back, I was (falsely) arrested in a case where the police seized my business laptop, after nearly a year and hundreds of phone calls to the police, my laptop was finally returned to me, and the case was dropped, however, my company had to shut down due to all my work being on that laptop, and I lost a very good company and people lost their jobs. This is all because the police could not "fit my job in" due to more important work in front of me, and never once kept me in the loop.

attributes.action: Have an honest open debate about the NHS, social care, future funding & needs.
attributes.background: All political parties disguise the truth facing the people of Britain; the NHS and social care is woefully underfunded and perhaps badly or structurally managed. In any event it does not meet our current or future needs and this is not just a problem for now it is a problem for many years to come.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many links where supporting "evidence" can be found and doubtless the government will point to contrary "evidence." But that misses the spirit of this petition - forget the politics let the people decide decide what we need and then how best to fund it. Nothing should be ruled out or in.

https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

https://fullfact.org/health/uk-health-spending-compared-france-and-germany/

attributes.action: Build more houses specifically for disabled people who own a blue disabled badge
attributes.background: it will help the disabled people move around their house freely and not rely on other people and in the long run it would be cheaper for all the councils within the UK because they don't have to keep changing the adaptions that's already been done in council houses that need to be updated.

attributes.action: Introduce 24 hour GP Surgeries throughout the UK to alleviate pressure on A&E
attributes.background: Going back thirty years ago we could call our GP practice and a GP would make a home visit resulting in far fewer unnecessary hospital visits to A&E. Today we have 111 which has increased the number of unnecessary A&E visits. Surely funding the return of night time GP's would be more productive.

attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Drivers of vehicles found driving without all four lights fully lit to be fined.
attributes.background: A Significant amount of vehicles are seen to be driving during evening and night hours without all four lights operating.This is a serious safety hazard, particularly on unlit roads and highways.
attributes.additional_details:
Driving during the nighttime is statistically more dangerous than by   daytime.
 Far too many lights burn out or dim between MOT tests, causing potential for serious accidents.

I ask the Government to give greater police powers in In this issue including issuing Penalty Notice and Penalty Points. 

I am convinced that these changes will make are roads even safer.

attributes.action: UK Government should provide incentives to foreign startups and small companies.
attributes.background: All foreign companies  contributes  a lot  UK economy, employment by paying taxes and creating jobs.  Government  has to amend Foreign Direct Investment policy to increase investments .This can be interest free loans or  discount in VAT or Taxes.Recognise them as 'MAKE IN UK' companies.
attributes.additional_details: Due to Brexit effect all foreign companies  are in big ambiguity whether to stay in UK or NOT.Especially startup companies,budding  entrepreneurs and small scale companies are mostly effected.Fear of upcoming changes in trading law  may discourage  their plans and ventures in UK. It’s going to effect largely to the future UK economy and the growth. UK Government should encourage them.

attributes.action: Prevent terrorist lorry attacks using temporary concrete stanchions.
attributes.background: Temporary concrete stanchions at public events and locations prevent terrorist lorry attacks. All UK locations where significant numbers of people are gathered in small spaces must be temporarily or permanently protected by suitable lorry stopping devices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36806691 This is established technology - after the attack in Berlin these devices were deployed, they should have been deployed beforehand. To not do so is pure ignorance. The argument that they are an eyesore is invalid, you can dress them up like Santa or Snowmen. Whatever is in keeping with the event.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: Protect pension funds by changing the law governing distributions by companies
attributes.background:
Companies Act 2006 fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous for personal gain

Signing this petition may be your best chance to secure the financial future of your company’s pension fund and your life in retirement.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves brought forward should be used to cover the pension fund deficit first before further distributions. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and remain with the company.

Read more at the-empty-chair(dot)com

attributes.action: Censor the broadcast of sexually explicit music to protect young children
attributes.background: I am petitioning the British Government to consider censoring the broadcast of sexually explicit music during the day to protect young listeners / viewers.
attributes.additional_details:
I've heard young children singing along to lyrics which are highly sexually suggestive. 

Over the last decade music has become increasingly sexualised and continues to evade existing censorship legislation / regulation.

attributes.action: Charge bus pass users 50p per single trip equating to £1 per return journey.
attributes.background: My husband and I are both pensioners but are not, by any means, "wealthy". Like most pensioners we appreciate a free bus pass but feel that a minimal charge each time we travel is not going to cause hardship. The money generated by this small charge could go towards desperate road repairs locally.

attributes.action: Start to pay off the UK's Debt.
attributes.background: We are all told as young people not to spend money which you don't have, so why should the UK government do it. It's not only getting bigger, but is effecting our NHS which should be run like the US government, to fix this tax the rich more, the poor shouldn't have to pay for the rich and vice versa

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory attendance to a 'Safe Drive Stay Alive' event
attributes.background: This event is used as means of reducing the amount of accidents and road collisions. It is vital that people are aware of the minor things that can significantly impact their lives, and the lives of others. I believe it should be made mandatory before a person can officially gain their licence.
attributes.additional_details:
'Stay Drive Stay Alive' found that young drivers are much more likely to be involved in a crash on the roads, often due to inexperience and a lack of knowledge of the risks. 
*Around 1 in 4 deaths on the road is aged 17-24*
The Safe Drive Stay Alive campaign will reach new and pre-drivers in an emotive and hard-hitting way, influencing behaviour and attitude on the roads.

attributes.action: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws.
attributes.background: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws....
attributes.additional_details:
The Government of Sierra Leone cracks down heavily on peaceful protests. It has become illegal to protest the injustices in the country without a police clearance. This is contrary to democracy and free speech. We, the people, hardly ever get the police clearance to voice our concerns. When we do, our voices are highly censored. We face hot water canons, live ammunition and police batons if we dare to protest without a police clearance. 
The UK Government gives a significant amount of aid to the Sierra Leonean government on the basis of it practicing democratic principles. Denying us the right to protest is undemocratic in every aspect. Cutting aid funds until they revisit those provisions that suppress free speech will force them into a civil dialogue with the people they ought to serve.

attributes.action: Limit how much a Estate Agent can charge for a Credit Check for new tenants
attributes.background: Credit searches for new tenants costs the Estate Agent around £7 a search. Most new tenants have to pay the Estate Agent between £120 and £250 for this. It's hard enough trying to fund a house move without the EA taking a huge chunk. This fee needs capping at no more that £50pp

attributes.action: Change the rules give children detained by police at school access to legal aid
attributes.background: Call for change to access legal aid so children can get justice against the actions of the police working in co-ordination with local authorities to secretly wrongfully detain innocent children at school, revoking their rights & right to their parents and misusing their data without any wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of police action to pre-plan with local authorities to detain an innocent 12 old child at school, the consequences of the event and negative impact to the child’s future education and misuse of data which may affect the child’s future, the system needs to change. Currently there is no protection for innocent children, due to the unfair system the public authorities’ access public money to engage legal experts to defend their actions. Children’s rights matter, legal aid is required.

attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.

attributes.action: Stop stereotyping teenagers by making national citizen service compulsory
attributes.background: We are a group of teenagers who feel like we are stereotyped frequently, such as being followed in shops, being stopped and searched in groups, seen as criminals and thugs, this makes us feel on edge and ashamed to be called a teenager. We feel our aim will make society a better place, aged 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: Our research found that often terms used to describe teenagers were "hoodies, louts, heartless, evil, frightening, scum, monsters, inhumane and threatening."

attributes.action: Total life Ban if caught using hand held mobile phone
attributes.background: If caught using a hand held mobile phone for talking or texting you should be given a total life time ban from driving.
